metadata.title: CVE-2017-3590 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Connectors component of Oracle MySQL(subcomponent: Connector/Python). Supported versions that are affected are2.1.5 and earlier. Easily "exploitable" vulnerability allows low privilegedattacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Connectors executesto compromise MySQL Connectors. Successful attacks of this vulnerabilitycan result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQLConnectors accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.3 (Integrity impacts).CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-mysql.connector - 2.1.6-1
python3-mysql.connector - 2.1.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-connector-python package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.6-1').
